name: Bhajan Kaur
biography: Bhajan Kaur is an Indian archer from Haryana, recognized for her achievements in the recurve discipline. She gained prominence for winning a bronze medal in the womenâ€™s team recurve event at the Asian Games 2022 in Hangzhou. Kaur is known for her impressive performances in various national and international competitions.
childhood: Kaur hails from a financially constrained family. She discovered her talent for archery in the 8th grade when a senior student left behind an archery bow at school. Her teacher encouraged her to try it, leading to her journey in the sport. Despite financial challenges, her father took loans to buy her an archery kit.
professional_career: Bhajan Kaur has achieved significant success in her short career, including winning gold medals at the National Games and participating in various international competitions. She was part of the Indian team that won a bronze medal at the 2022 Asian Games and has continued to excel in events like the Archery World Cup and Youth World Championships.
